summary: Glossy skin for all female character
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=10][color=blue][b]Gloss shine for all female character[/b][/color][/size]
Click to enlarge[url=http://img826.imageshack.us/img826/1049/glosstechcomparison.jpg][img]http://img36.imageshack.us/img36/1049/glosstechcomparison.jpg[/img][/url][/center]


[b]Description[/b]
This mod give at all the female character in game a *very natural* gloss shine
Now you can chose the level of gloss using the GlossTech technology

[b]Why such small files?[/b]
All the body texture that you see in game are made of 4 file
Example:
femalebody.dds
femalebody_msn,dds
femalebody_s.dds
femalebody_sk.dds

The first file is a flat texture of the object, in fact all the curves are made by a nif file and the lighting by the _msn file
The _sk file is the mipmap
The file that adds the gloss skin is the _s file

I did different tests before posting this mod.
First I tried to increase the lighting of the _s file, but this doens\'t work properly with femfeet installed.
Then I tried to transform the _msn file to an _s file; this solution works fine only for some views, but not for other.
Afetr performing this step i\'ve noticed that the complexity of the map doesn\'t alter the effect in game [at least with my setting], so I tried to make a total white map of 8x8 pixel [Less is more]
Trust me, it just works very well.

The files are three:
femalebody_1_s.dds 
femalehands_1_s.dds
femalehead_s.dds

I think that this mod is compatible for all the body mod so far, but if it doesn\'t work for you, tell me what mod you use and I\'ll try to solve your problem.

[size=5][color=black][b]Installation:[/b][/color][/size]

Since 2.0[list]
[*]Install manually or using NMM [recommended]
[*]Start GlossTech in the data folder [on vista/7 as admin]
[*]Follow the instruction [ATTENTION: After clicking at \"Start glossing\" the program can take a couple of minute, be quite and do something else]
[*]When all the windows are closed, WELL DONE, you finished :D
[/list]

[quote]Well, it seems most of the problems people are having is due to win7 and admin rights. I came by this problem today when I was going to install this mod on my mates comp. It ran smoothly on my own so I wouldn\'t have caught it otherwise. Perhaps I can help some of you out, so here goes:

Unless you have removed certain restrictions from win7 it won\'t allow files to be saved into certain directories without admin rights. This may apply to Skyrim\'s default install directory. That problem is usually solved by running an application in admin mode (right click etc), however in this case the problem starts when you run GlossTech.exe while placed in your Data directory. You see if you don\'t run this as admin too, the generated files won\'t be saved into the textures folder. You will not get an error message, it will run as if it works only the files won\'t be there, hence the TexBlend will not work properly and you get all sorts of weirdness like super glossy face etc.

So how do you solve this? Well, you can run both applications as an admin from your Data folder OR if there\'s still some stupid restriction in place you can use this work around:

Extract the files on your desktop instead on into your Data folder. Run both applications according to the description of this mod. Yes, do the whole process on your desktop instead of in your Data folder, including TexBlend. Once done copy everything into your Data folder and overwrite when prompted. Voila!

Hope that helps some poor soul out there to achieve glossy goodness! ;) [/quote]

A user noticed that load order affect the correct execution of GlossTech [but i don\'t know why O_O]
[quote]
Solved it! It was indeed the installation-order, at least for me. Perhaps it helps others too... I used following installation-sequence:
1.CHSBHC-Body-Physics
2.CBBE or HighRes 4K CBBE
3.After that BodySlide, then TexBlendLite in CBBE optional
4.Face-Texture (in my case Bellas version) (and I think, I did something wrong here in previous trys)
5.Covereyes
6.Then I followed the instructions of this very, very cool mod and ol√°! [/quote]

[b]ChangeLog[/b]

Version 2.5

    Add (nearly)complet support for custom races
    Solved some little bug
    Added some strange thing for avoid possibly errors

Version 2.2

    Removed an useless form [you never see it]
    Solved the \"modify the mesh\" problem

Version 2.1

    Removed an useless button [useless, but can broke the program XD]

Version 2.0

    Brand new version
    Everything rewritten from scratch in VB.net
    Add the man glossing procedure
    Add procedure to cover all the face
    Improved backup procedure

Version 1.7

    Try to fix the shiny blocky areas on the face

Version 1.6

    Fixed NMM installation

Version 1.5

    Added initial support for custom races
    Updated TexBlend from 0.9.1 to 0.9.2
    Add backup and uninstalling functionality
    Added some comments on the suorce file and GPL license

Version 1.2

    Deleted some file that i forgotten

Version 1.1

    Change file path

Version 1.0

    Include Caliente Texture Blender
    Create a tiny program for chose the level of gloss
    Deleted the lip gloss 

Version 0.5

    Finally, add the head files
    redone the description page

Version 0.3

    do five TRUE different version [see screenshoot]
    TODO: the head file

Version 0.2b

    Add none, low, mid and high version, but not tested the effect in game
    Deletted the head file [i reupload when i able to do a better one]
    TODO: Add multiple screenshoot of all version
    TODO: Test the different version

Version 0.1

    First public release
    Tested compatibility whit: Caliente Female Body Mod Slim Body Edition whit hands and feet

[b]Compatibility[/b]

    Tested by me[list]
         [*][url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2666]Caliente Female Body Mod Slim Body Edition whit hands and feet[/url]
         [*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5404]SilverX10[/url]
         [*][url=http://www.loverslab.com/showthread.php?tid=4367]Young smooth small-breasted body and face (CBBE3 UPDATE)[/url]
         [*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=6923]Extended Slider Colors [/url]
         [/list]

Tested by other[list]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4888]CHSBHC body mod and BBP [/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7608]Addys Invisible Armor Set[/url]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3234]Hidden Quivers [/url]
[/list]
    Probably compatible[list]
         [*][url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2666]Caliente Female Body Mod - all edition[/url][/list]

    Not compatible[list]
        [*]Only those change the texture used for body
         [/list]
